item.title: Oxford-1820 v1.3.9.1
item.description:
Product: Oxford-1820 v1.3.9.1
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Mon, 13 Mar 2023 17:15:45 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for controlling the Oxford 18/20 magnet

Release Notes: Fixes:
- update to Instrument Framework v1.12.6
- Change \approx tolerance from 0.005 to 0.00005
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.12.6.1
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.12.6.1
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Sun, 19 Feb 2023 20:35:03 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.12.6]
Remote Control:
- disable debugging in ZMQ methods (mirror changes in required ZMQ v3.6.3.113)
- change reentrancy of some ZMQ and JSON-RPC methods

[1.12.5]
- Add Local Client.vim option to more easily communicate with Instrument process via Events rather than ZMQ/TCP (e.g. from UI process)
- Add Get/Set Heater abstract methods

[1.12.4]
- Bug fixes and improvemtns to ZMQ subsystem

[1.12.3]
- Issue #80: Fix issue with read/write message states not propagating connection info
- Update State History to include longer and controllable history
- minor subsystem UI updates

[1.12.2]
- Issue #78: Change magnet set point tolerance to 0.01 T
- Issue #79: Change temperature set point tolerance to 0.01 K and add control for comparison mode (in range, less than, greater than)

[1.12.1]
- Issue #77: fix issue preventing communication across the network

[1.12.0]
This release has major changes in the way configuration is handled. You should make the following changes to your code:
- "Read Configuration File" and "Write Configuration File" should be configured to <i>call parent method</i>
- "Get SMO PGSQL Log Paths" will need two front panel controls to match the parent method
- Instrument.Template.lvclass:Instrument.Template.AppLauncher has improvements to allow the user easier access to configuration
- Front panel controls
- examine configuration.ini state (and macro)
- refinements to SMO start and stop macros
- Data: Wait state
- If you use Configuration.lvclass directly (likely in UI process), should can use "Write Section" to control the ini header
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: ZeroMQ Socket Library v3.6.3.113
item.description:
Product: ZeroMQ Socket Library v3.6.3.113
Company: Martijn Jasperse
Release Date: Sat, 18 Feb 2023 15:56:29 -0500
Packager: Martijn Jasperse

Description: LabVIEW bindings for ZeroMQ, the communication library that provides simple many-many messaging and other topologies.

Release Notes: - separate compiled code from all library VIs and classes
- disable debugging and automatic error handling in all library VIs
- change reentrancy of zmq_recv_multi.vi to "preallocated shared"

*This version compiled by Patrick Irvin (ciozi137) with LabVIEW 2019 and VIPM 2022
item.dc:creator: Martijn Jasperse

item.title: LV-Data v3.5.1.2
item.description:
Product: LV-Data v3.5.1.2
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Sun, 29 Jan 2023 12:13:17 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Collection of VIs to write and read TDMS, Igor Text Files (*.itx), text-based spreadsheet data files (*.dat), postgreSQL. Tools are also provided for uploading to and downloading from AWS S3.

Release Notes: [3.5.1]
- Issue #92: Add rudimentary support for AWS CLI (alpha)
- Issue #93: Harmonize parsing data from dat, TDMS with multiple groups, folder of TDMS
- Issue #94: Fix issue with saving a TDMS file where a TDMS file already exists
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

Release Notes: [1.0.9]

Bug fixes:
- fix issue with reading TDMS file with multiple groups vs folder of TDMS files
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Transport v1.6.2.1
item.description:
Product: Transport v1.6.2.1
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Thu, 01 Dec 2022 15:26:55 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
- Control Experiment.vi
- provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device
- record how the lockin is connected to the device
- configure the Krohn Hite amplifier
- set the base path for saving data
- configure peripheral instruments

[Transport.lvclass]
Basic transport measurments:
- Lockin vs time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi)

[SweepControl.lvclass]
- Sweep Control.vi:
- Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
- Continuous B sweep.vi:
- Sweep B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

Release Notes: [1.6.2]
- Issue #66: Improve Lockin_sweep: UI controls, R graph plots and plot legend
- Issue #67: Improve Continuous B Sweep UI
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Transport v1.6.1.2
item.description:
Product: Transport v1.6.1.2
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 18 Nov 2022 11:38:51 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
- Control Experiment.vi
- provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device
- record how the lockin is connected to the device
- configure the Krohn Hite amplifier
- set the base path for saving data
- configure peripheral instruments

[Transport.lvclass]
Basic transport measurments:
- Lockin vs time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi

[SweepControl.lvclass]
- Sweep Control.vi:
- Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
- Continuous B sweep.vi:
- Sweep B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

Release Notes: [1.6.1]
- Issue #54: Fix R2/R4 G2/G4 plot labels in Lockin_sweep
- Issue #55: better support for calling lockin_sweep as a subVI of Sweep Control and Continuous B Sweep
- Issue #56: Confirm Control Experiment shutdown
- Issue #61: Add write accessor for device (Mini Control Experiment)
- Issue #62: Fix R vs T and B graphs in Lockin_time
- Issue #64: fix issue with graphing a sweep that does not use the first sweep channel
- Modify API methods for reading json-formatted metadata from TDMS files
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.8.10.3
item.description:
Product: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.8.10.3
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 11:29:13 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Monitor and Control application inheritng from Instrument Framework and SMO
- Log instrument status to the PGSQL database.
- UI and API for controlling magnet field, temperature, and rotator angle (PPMS2 only)

Release Notes: - change Set Magnet deadband to 1 Oe
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
